channel.title: Humble THQ Bundle
channel.description:
Just posting here if anyone's missed it:
[url='https://www.humblebundle.com/']Humble THQ Bundle (pay what you want and help charity)[/url]
CoH + expansions, Red Faction, Darksiders, and Metro 2033 all in this bundle.
Finally got Metro 2033, and for only a dollar.

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
That said, big companies have to realize at some point that they don’t need to spend dozens of millions of dollars making shallow games when smaller companies are making more critically acclaimed games for a fraction of both the price of production and sale at a higher net revenue per sale.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Well indies and AAA titles are just ways of defining budgets to a degree and funding. To be honest indie if used properly is never a good descriptor. Given that Valve can put out titles that qualify as both indie and AAA. I’d like to see the games industry shift from “What can we fund that will make us the most absurd amount of money” to “This is an interesting project how can we fund it to make money” I dislike how a lot of gaming has become this its either AAA or indie what happened to the in between.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Maxey:

Ideally, the industry would evolve to a point when there are no indies and AAA titles, just fucking games to be enjoyed equally by everyone.

What he said. It really doesn’t matter that much what’s it’s labelled as, so long as there are good companies making good games.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Ideally, the industry would evolve to a point when there are no indies and AAA titles, just fucking games to be enjoyed equally by everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I realize the each Bundle will more than likely get the same attention regardless of content. My worry is this evolving into a non-Indie thing.

Maxey may be right when he says the Humble crew has the final say, but anyone can be corrupted. No exceptions.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
So what if there are more big corporations putting humble bundles together? Its not even like the humble bundles have ever competed with each other. They occur at different times. It’d be a more valid complaint if THQ came out and said “hey where are going to do our own charity pay what you want deal” while an indie bundle was going on but its not. The next indie bundle will get the same attention the it would if this had been an indie bundle.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
mankyman6:

I’m worried about it turning into a welcome mat for other companies to merge their way into the Humble Bundle. Sure, this is just THQ for this one event, but what about future Bundles?

Fair enough, but I’m sure the final say is still on the Humble Crew’s decision.

Maybe this was just an exception to the rule.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I’m worried about it turning into a welcome mat for other companies to merge their way into the Humble Bundle. Sure, this is just THQ for this one event, but what about future Bundles?

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
I still don’t understand that logic. This isn’t robbing indies of any attention. Each bundle sale is its own event. They aren’t mixing AAA games with small indies, this is just THQ stuff for this one event.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I don’t care about the price-cuts. I care about the publicity, Indie developers and how Humble Bundle should leave AAA publicity to others and focus more on the Indies.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Steam sales sometimes sells games at like a dollar or so, how is this any more different? In fact, by paying only what you want, you’re basically only giving them as much money as do you think they’re worth to you, making it more fair for you than it is for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
That may be, but I still don’t like the idea of this becoming common-place.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Except THQ is in some serious financial troubles right now and this actually improved their stock a little bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Way to sarcasm, ass hat

I always thought of the Humble Bundle as a means for Indie developers to get more exposure, not for companies to abuse in order to stuff their already overflowing wallets.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Yeah. It really sucks that they can get exposure just by giving ridiculous deals on their games and giving some of the profit to charity.

Read full topic

item.title: Humble THQ Bundle
